items.title: Sheikh Hasina: The pro-democracy icon who became an autocrat
items.description: Sheikh Hasina is credited for the country's economic progress but also accused of authoritarianism.

items.title: Moment Ex-Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina's sentence is announced
items.description: Hasina has called the court's decision "biased and politically motivated" in a statement released after the verdict.

items.title: South African man seen at neo-Nazi rally has Australian visa revoked
items.description: The civil engineer was seen in the front row of a protest organised by the National Socialist Network.

items.title: Communist and far-right candidates head to Chile presidential run-off
items.description: The Communist Party's Jeanette Jara will face far-right candidate Jos√© Antonio Kast in the second round of voting in December.

items.title: Dozens of Indian pilgrims killed in bus accident in Saudi Arabia
items.description: Forty-five people were killed in the accident, while one survivor is in hospital, an Indian official said.
